p: Novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) spread to all regions of Italy on January 31, 2020. The northern region of Lombardy was identified as the center of the two main Italian clusters of cases. On March 11, 2020, the Director-General of the WHO declared COVID-19 a global pandemic as the virus spread rapidly from China to the rest of the world, particularly Europe ( 1). Currently, the scientific community is sharing potentially useful data to treat patients and protect the population, but the details of COVID-19 infection are still largely unknown, and thus options for risk assessment and pharmacological intervention have only been partially developed.
